meanings.definition: Apply fresh lubricant to (something) to reduce friction and wear.
meanings.sent1: I need to relubricate the bike chain to make it move smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will relubricate the engine to keep it in good condition.
meanings.sent3: After the robot stopped, it realized it forgot to relubricate its joints!
meanings.sent4: The squeaky door hinges were relubricated, and now they whisper with each movement.
meanings.sent5: Relubricating the gears is like giving them a refreshing drink to keep them happy.

meanings.definition: To add lubricant again to (something) to keep it running smoothly.
meanings.sent1: Dad will relubricate the car engine to ensure it runs without any issues.
meanings.sent2: The maintenance team will relubricate the factory machines for optimal performance.
meanings.sent3: The robot chef decided to relubricate its wheels with cooking oil for a tasty twist!
meanings.sent4: Relubricating the relationship between the two countries will promote peace and understanding.
meanings.sent5: The bicycle chain sings in gratitude after relubricating it with care.
